column2: Submarines are small boats equipped with torpedoes and a gun. They are submergible, but to attack they still have to go to the surface.
column3: Les sous-marins sont de petits bâtiments équipés de torpilles et d'un canon. Ils sont submersibles, mais doivent faire surface pour attaquer.
column4: U-Boote sind mit Torpedos und einem Geschütz ausgerüstete Kleinschiffe. Sie können abtauchen, müssen zum Abgriff aber auftauchen.
column6: Los submarinos son pequeñas naves equipadas con torpedos y un cañón. Son sumergibles, pero todavía tienen que subir a la superficie para atacar.

column2: The lessons learned from submarine warfare during the First World War were applied to submarine construction in the 1920s and 1930s, further enhancing the submarine as a weapon of naval warfare.
column3: Les enseignements tirés de la guerre sous-marine du premier conflit mondial furent appliqués à la construction de sous-marins dans les années 1920 et 1930 et renforcèrent le sous-marin en tant qu'arme de guerre navale.
column4: Die Erfahrungen des ersten Weltkriegs flossen in den 1920er und 1930er Jahren in den U-Boot-Bau ein, wodurch diese Schiffe für die Seekriegsführung noch bedeutender wurden.
column6: Las lecciones extraídas de la Primera Guerra Mundial se aplicaron a la construcción de submarinos durante los años 20 y 30, que vivieron un desarrollo aún mayor de este tipo de buques como armas de guerra.

column2: Submarine design continued to improve in the early 20th-century, to the point where submarines became able to spend significant amounts of time at sea, allowing them to intercept enemy warships and shipping at a significant distance from home bases.
column3: La conception des sous-marins a continué de s'améliorer au début du 20e siècle, en un point où les sous-marins sont devenus capable de passer beaucoup de temps en mer, leur permettant d'intercepter les navires de guerre ennemis et d'entreprendre des expéditions à grande distance de leurs bases d'attache.
column4: Das U-Boot-Design wurde im frühen 20. Jahrhundert so weit verbessert, dass U-Boote beträchtliche Zeit auf See verbringen konnten. Dies ermöglichte ihnen, feindliche Kriegs- und Handelsschiffe weit vor deren Heimatstützpunkten abzufangen.
column6: El diseño de submarinos continuó mejorando a comienzos del siglo XX, hasta llegar a buques capaces de permanecer periodos significativos en el mar, lo que les permitía interceptar a los barcos de guerra enemigos y operar a gran distancia de sus bases.

column2: Our shipyards are built according to our old traditions.
Each province has its own currencies.
The government adopted some currencies as official but doesn't issue them through a central bank.
The government enforces a single currency issued by a few authorized banks. This is the beginning of currency centralization and standardization
There are no western universities in our country.
Universities are built following foreign standards, the professors who teach are usually foreign or graduated in foreign institutions and they teach western philosophy and sciences.
Artillery is made up of ineffective siege equipment or it's not present at all.
Our artillery is imported from western powers.
Spoken language is the only way of communication. There are no documents or writing language, no education system and no codified national language.
We have a writing system and an official written language, used all around by the government. Without a written language, we can't have a modernized state.
With technological advances in armor, and the coming of automobiles, units that use these technologies have become increasingly more common place, ready to assume their role on the battlefield.
Light Armor has assumed a place in our armies for a fair length of time, however, with further advances in armor designs, even more robust armor may now be deployed on the battlefield.
Advanced in battlefield innovations have allowed for a greater firepower.
Advances in the technological prowess of our more modern troops in the field of battle has increased their innate technological advantage.
Increased integration of different mechanized units has allowed for greater superiority on the battlefield.
